page.title: 04THE A45 IN OUR AREA
page.content: The A45 road links the Cambridge area and the East coast, passing Newmarket, Bury St. Edmunds, Stowmarket and Ipswich. It carries goods and people to and from the ports. The A45 is quite a new road. It has two carriageways and a central reservation. The verges are planted with young trees of many kinds. We counted the traffic on the A45. We stood on a bridge. First we counted the traffic going East (Towards Stowmarket) for ten minutes. We used a stopwatch. We looked for cars, diggers, motor-bikes, buses, tractors, police cars, caravans, lorries, fire engines, ambulances, vans, breakdown trucks and three-wheelers. 112 vehicles were going East, 121 vehicles were going West. Altogether we counted 146 cars, 53 lorries, 27 vans,4 motor-bikes and 3 caravans.
